alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Dawson; Greeley; Howard; Nance; Sherman; Valley (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 01 at 2:17PM CST until January 03 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM MONDAY TO NOON CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches and ice accumulations of two tenths to four tenths of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Portions of central Nebraska. * WHEN...From 6 AM Monday to noon CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are likely due to the ice. Travel could be nearly impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact both commutes on Monday, and at least the morning commute on Tuesday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Areas of freezing rain will develop across the area Monday morning, and continue through the rest of the day. Freezing rain will change over to snow Monday evening or Monday night, before tapering off to mainly flurries by Tuesday afternoon. The highest snow accumulations are expected to be north of Highway 92. Increasing northwesterly wind gusts up to 35 MPH may cause blowing snow, as well as tree and power line damage Monday night through Tuesday.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
